action.action-desc: Ms. Tenney introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Labor to conduct a study on the effectiveness of spending by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration to provide technical assistance and compliance assistance in relation to heat-related illness.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Timothy J. Barber Act.

section.header: Report on heat-related illness in cool-weather States

subsection.text: The Secretary of Labor shall conduct a study on spending by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration to provide technical assistance and compliance assistance in relation to heat-related illness, includingâ€”

paragraph.text: the effectiveness of such spending at both national and regional levels; and
determining how such spending may be made more effective.

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall submit to Congress a report containing the results of such study, including recommendations on legislative actions or other actions that may be necessary to improve the effectiveness of such spending.
